alert.note: Alert for Larimer and Boulder Counties Between 6000 and 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 31 at 10:10PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH FOR TONIGHT IS CANCELLED... The Flash Flood Watch is cancelled for a portion of north central Colorado, including the following area, Larimer and Boulder Counties Between 6000 and 9000 Feet. Flooding is no longer expected to pose a threat. Please continue to heed remaining road closures. && ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of north central Colorado, including the following area, Larimer and Boulder Counties Between 6000 and 9000 Feet. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon through Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Most thunderstorms have diminished and moved out of the area. Only light rainfall amounts can be expected from passing showers late this evening. The threat of flash flooding tonight has diminished. However, another round of heavy rain producing thunderstorms is expected again Tuesday afternoon and evening. Stronger storms will be capable of producing 1 to 1.5 inches of rain in less than an hour.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Larimer and Boulder Counties Between 6000 and 9000 Feet
